fullDescription.intro: Generates date&time values, i.e. either a date, a time, a date&time (local) or a zoned date&time. There are three creation modes: Either a number of rows, a starting point, and an ending point is selected (the steps in between will be calculated), or a number of rows, a starting point and a duration is selected (the duration defines the steps between each row), or a starting point, an ending point and a duration is selected (the number of rows corresponds to how often the duration fits between start and end).

tab.name: Output Settings
tab.option: The type to create can be selected. It can be either a date, time, (local) date&time, or zoned date&time.
The name of the created column can be chosen.

tab.name: Mode Selection
tab.option:
A fixed number of rows will be created by either
selecting a start and end date&time with equal steps between each row
or selecting a start date&time and a duration (i.e. size of steps between each row). The ending point depends on the selected number of rows.

A variable number of rows will be created. A start and end date&time and a duration (i.e. size of steps between each row) must be selected. As many rows as possible will be created. The last created row will contain a date&time value which is before/equal the selected end (if the duration is positive, otherwise after/equal).

tab.name: Starting Point
tab.option: The starting point can be chosen. If the execution time shall be used, the checkbox can be checked. The selected date has the format yyyy-MM-dd, the selected time can either have the format HH:mm:ss or HH:mm:ss.SSS.

tab.name: Ending Point
tab.option:
Either a duration (time based) or period (date based) can be chosen. It describes the size of the steps between each created row. The inserted string can be either in
1. the ISO-8601 representation (see period format or duration format for details), examples below,
2. the short letter representation (e.g. '2y 3M 1d')
Period: y: years, M: months, d: days
Duration: H: hours, m: minutes, s: seconds
or
3. the long word representation (e.g. '2 years 3 months 1 day').
Examples for ISO-8601 (Period):
"P2Y" parses as "+2 years"
"P-2Y" parses as "-2 years"
"P1Y2M3W4D" parses as "1 year, 2 months, 3 weeks and 4 days"
Examples for ISO-8601 (Duration):
"PT15M" parses as "+15 minutes"
"-PT15M" parses as "-15 minutes"
"PT2H15M3.5S" parses as "2 hours, 15 minutes and 3.5 seconds"

The end point can be chosen. If the execution time shall be used, the checkbox can be checked. The selected date has the format yyyy-MM-dd, the selected time can either have the format HH:mm:ss or HH:mm:ss.SSS. If zoned date&time cells shall be created, the time zone will be the same as the time zone of the starting point.

ports.outPort: Output table containing the created date&time column.
